<!-- source-hash: d9f71c8fc34d37f2076c63358a86b0d1 -->
A data transfer object (DTO) that represents the response structure for log event queries in the audit system, containing essential event metadata and details.

## Key Components

- **`toolEventId`** - Unique identifier for the tool event (e.g., "evt_123456")
- **`eventType`** - Type of event that occurred (e.g., "login", "logout")
- **`ingestDay`** - Date when the event was ingested in YYYY-MM-DD format
- **`toolType`** - Source tool that generated the event (e.g., "meshcentral")
- **`severity`** - Event severity level (e.g., "INFO", "WARN", "ERROR")
- **`userId`** - ID of the user associated with the event
- **`deviceId`** - ID of the device associated with the event
- **`summary`** - Human-readable event summary
- **`timestamp`** - When the event occurred (as Instant)

## Usage Example

```java
// Creating a log response
LogResponse response = LogResponse.builder()
    .toolEventId("evt_123456")
    .eventType("login")
    .ingestDay("2024-01-15")
    .toolType("meshcentral")
    .severity("INFO")
    .userId("user_789")
    .deviceId("device_456")
    .summary("User logged in successfully")
    .timestamp(Instant.now())
    .build();

// Accessing fields
String eventId = response.getToolEventId();
Instant eventTime = response.getTimestamp();
```

The class uses Lombok annotations for automatic generation of constructors, getters/setters, and builder pattern. OpenAPI annotations provide schema documentation for API responses.
